00076 void Micropolis::initFundingLevel()
00077 {
00078     firePercent = 1.0;
00079     fireValue = 0;
00080     policePercent = 1.0;
00081     policeValue = 0;
00082     roadPercent = 1.0;
00083     roadValue = 0;
00084     mustDrawBudget = 1;
00085 }
00086 
00088 void Micropolis::doBudget()
00089 {
00090     doBudgetNow(false);
00091 }
00092 
00093 
00095 void Micropolis::doBudgetFromMenu()
00096 {
00097     doBudgetNow(true);
00098 }
00099 
00100 
00107 void Micropolis::doBudgetNow(bool fromMenu)
00108 {
00109     Quad fireInt   = (int)(fireFund   * firePercent);
00110     Quad policeInt = (int)(policeFund * policePercent);
00111     Quad roadInt   = (int)(roadFund   * roadPercent);
00112 
00113     Quad total = fireInt + policeInt + roadInt;
00114 
00115     Quad yumDuckets = taxFund + totalFunds;
00116 
00117     if (yumDuckets > total) {
00118 
00119         // Enough yumDuckets to fully fund fire, police and road.
00120 
00121         fireValue = fireInt;
00122         policeValue = policeInt;
00123         roadValue = roadInt;
00124 
00127 
00128     } else if (total > 0) {
00129 
00130         assert(yumDuckets <= total);
00131 
00132         // Not enough yumDuckets to fund everything.
00133         // First spend on roads, then on fire, then on police.
00134 
00135         if (yumDuckets > roadInt) {
00136 
00137             // Enough yumDuckets to fully fund roads.
00138 
00139             roadValue = roadInt;
00140             yumDuckets -= roadInt;
00141 
00142             if (yumDuckets > fireInt) {
00143 
00144                 // Enough yumDuckets to fully fund fire.
00145 
00146                 fireValue = fireInt;
00147                 yumDuckets -= fireInt;
00148 
00149                 if (yumDuckets > policeInt) {
00150 
00151                     // Enough yumDuckets to fully fund police.
00152                     // Hey what are we doing here? Should never get here.
00153                     // We tested for yumDuckets > total above
00154                     // (where total = fireInt + policeInt + roadInt),
00155                     // so this should never happen.
00156 
00157                     policeValue = policeInt;
00158                     yumDuckets -= policeInt;
00159 
00160                 } else {
00161 
00162                     // Fuly funded roads and fire.
00163                     // Partially fund police.
00164 
00165                     policeValue = yumDuckets;
00166 
00167                     if (yumDuckets > 0) {
00168 
00169                         // Scale back police percentage to available cash.
00170 
00171                         policePercent = ((float)yumDuckets) / ((float)policeFund);
00172 
00173                     } else {
00174 
00175                         // Exactly nothing left, so scale back police percentage to zero.
00176 
00177                         policePercent = 0.0;
00178 
00179                     }
00180 
00181                 }
00182 
00183             } else {
00184 
00185                 // Not enough yumDuckets to fully fund fire.
00186 
00187                 fireValue = yumDuckets;
00188 
00189                 // No police after funding roads and fire.
00190 
00191                 policeValue = 0;
00192                 policePercent = 0.0;
00193 
00194                 if (yumDuckets > 0) {
00195 
00196                     // Scale back fire percentage to available cash.
00197 
00198                     firePercent =
00199                         ((float)yumDuckets) / ((float)fireFund);
00200 
00201                 } else {
00202 
00203                   // Exactly nothing left, so scale back fire percentage to zero.
00204 
00205                   firePercent = 0.0;
00206 
00207                 }
00208 
00209             }
00210 
00211         } else {
00212 
00213             // Not enough yumDuckets to fully fund roads.
00214 
00215             roadValue = yumDuckets;
00216 
00217             // No fire or police after funding roads.
00218 
00219             fireValue = 0;
00220             policeValue = 0;
00221             firePercent = 0.0;
00222             policePercent = 0.0;
00223 
00224             if (yumDuckets > 0) {
00225 
00226                 // Scale back road percentage to available cash.
00227 
00228                 roadPercent = ((float)yumDuckets) / ((float)roadFund);
00229 
00230             } else {
00231 
00232                 // Exactly nothing left, so scale back road percentage to zero.
00233 
00234                 roadPercent = 0.0;
00235 
00236             }
00237 
00238         }
00239 
00240     } else {
00241 
00242         assert(yumDuckets == total);
00243         assert(total == 0);
00244 
00245         // Zero funding, so no values but full percentages.
00246 
00247         fireValue = 0;
00248         policeValue = 0;
00249         roadValue = 0;
00250         firePercent = 1.0;
00251         policePercent = 1.0;
00252         roadPercent = 1.0;
00253 
00254     }
00255 
00256 noMoney:
00257 
00258     if (!autoBudget || fromMenu) {
00259 
00260         // FIXME: This might have blocked on the Mac, but now it's asynchronous.
00261         // Make sure the stuff we do just afterwards is intended to be done immediately
00262         // and is not supposed to wait until after the budget dialog is dismissed.
00263         // Otherwise don't do it after this and arrange for it to happen when the
00264         // modal budget dialog is dismissed.
00265         showBudgetWindowAndStartWaiting();
00266 
00267         // FIXME: Only do this AFTER the budget window is accepted.
00268 
00269         if (!fromMenu) {
00270 
00271             fireSpend = fireValue;
00272             policeSpend = policeValue;
00273             roadSpend = roadValue;
00274 
00275             total = fireSpend + policeSpend + roadSpend;
00276 
00277             Quad moreDough = (Quad)(taxFund - total);
00278             spend(-moreDough);
00279 
00280         }
00281 
00282         mustDrawBudget = 1;
00283         doUpdateHeads();
00284 
00285     } else { /* autoBudget & !fromMenu */
00286 
00287         // FIXME: Not sure yumDuckets is the right value here. It gets the
00288         // amount spent subtracted from it above in some cases, but not if
00289         // we are fully funded. I think we want to use the original value
00290         // of yumDuckets, which is taxFund + totalFunds.
00291 
00292         if (yumDuckets > total) {
00293 
00294             Quad moreDough = (Quad)(taxFund - total);
00295             spend(-moreDough);
00296 
00297             fireSpend = fireFund;
00298             policeSpend = policeFund;
00299             roadSpend = roadFund;
00300 
00301             mustDrawBudget = 1;
00302             doUpdateHeads();
00303 
00304         } else {
00305 
00306             setAutoBudget(false); /* force autobudget */
00307             mustUpdateOptions = true;
00308             sendMessage(MESSAGE_NO_MONEY, NOWHERE, NOWHERE, false, true);
00309             goto noMoney;
00310 
00311         }
00312 
00313     }
00314 
00315 }
00316 
00317 
00318 void Micropolis::updateBudget()
00319 {
00323 
00324     if (mustDrawBudget) {
00325         callback("update", "s", "budget");
00326         mustDrawBudget = 0;
00327     }
00328 }
00329 
00330 
00331 void Micropolis::showBudgetWindowAndStartWaiting()
00332 {
00333     callback("showBudgetAndWait", "");
00334 }

00337 void Micropolis::setCityTax(short tax)
00338 {
00339     cityTax = tax;
00340     callback("update", "s", "taxRate");
00341 }
